page.title: 17Royal Visit to Darlington
page.content: On 14th May 1985{HM Queen Elizabeth {the Queen Mother}visited Darlington Railway Station. She was on her way to{Catterick}to celebrate the 300th anniversary of the{Queen's Own Hussar {Regiment,}she was invited because she is their colonel in chief. She travelled from London to Darling- ton by train and a car was waiting at{Bank Top Station}to take her to Catterick. While she was in Darling- ton she was asked to name a new inter city 125 train. The train was called{"The Queens Own Hussars". { Michael Fearnhead}a pupil of{Red {Hall School}presented the Queen Mother with a bouquet of flowers. He was chosen because his father is the Area Manager for British Rail. His parents were very proud of him.{ } {C.E.Port and pupils
